name: Dumbbell Floor Press
how_to_perform:
* Start by lying on your back on a flat surface, such as a mat or floor. Hold one dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing towards your body.
* Place the upper chest under the dumbbells and squeeze the shoulder blades together to maintain a stable position.
* Lower the dumbbells down toward the ground by bending the elbows until they approach a 90-degree angle, keeping the movement controlled.
* Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement.
* Press the dumbbells back up towards the ceiling by extending the arms fully and squeezing the chest muscles.
* Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: The Dumbbell Floor Press is an upper body exercise that targets the chest, shoulders, and triceps, utilizing dumbbells for resistance.
alternative_names: Incline Dumbbell Press (with floor as incline)
